messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Sweet Balance Info
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/9/00 12:50:13 AM Central Daylight Time, lurine@softcom.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/9/00 12:50:13 AM Central Daylight Time,
lurine@... writes:

<< I look at all the websites and could not find a definitive answer as to
what Sweet Balance is made from. Can someone aim me in the right
direction???

Lynda

>>
Hi-- I'll copy from the brochure the information: "What is Sweet Balance?:
A great tasting, all-natural sweetener made from real fruit. As a low
glycemic sweetener, Sweet Balance is beneficial to almost any dietary
program. It's safe for diabetics, children, pregnant and nursing mothers,
hypoglycemics, and anyone with special dietary restrictions."
"Sweet
Balance is not a chemical sweetener or an herbal sweetener. It is a natural,
fruit sweetener that is safe for use by anyone... Most people don't know
this, but Equal, Sweet 'n Low, Spoonable stevia, and stevia packets contain
high glycemic fattening ingredients... Sweet Balance is low glycemic. It is
excellent for those concerned with hyperactivity, dyslexia, and tooth decay."

"The Glycemic Research Institute in Wash. DC has given Sweet Balance their
Seal of Approval. along with their special Pediatric Seal of Approval."
Hope
this helps! :) ~Karen
